Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-orange pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey-black in section, the exterior is slightly grooved and bears faint traces of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394420) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394420)
